## AlGlobalizer class

AlGlobalizer is a simple tool for exposing encapsulated code selectively in global scope, and for ensuring that singleton instances are, in fact, singletons.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class AlGlobalizer 
```

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [expose(name, data)](./common.alglobalizer.expose.md) | <code>static</code> | Exposes arbitrary data on a nested global property of <code>window</code>, using object merging to allow complex object composition or updates. |
|  [instantiate(name, factory, collisionHandling)](./common.alglobalizer.instantiate.md) | <code>static</code> | Instantiates an instance of a global singleton. This is used primarily to avoid collisions. |
